result.execSummary:
The defendant William Albert Lucansky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, William Albert Lucansky was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Albert Lucansky is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • William Albert Lucansky was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Albert Lucansky

records.addlTxt: Attempting to collect Court Ordered Financial Obligations through SDC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Regarding Jail Credit

Defendant William Albert Lucansky in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant William Albert Lucansky in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states his motion.  Spoke with DOC on Thursday and discussed transfer of probation to state of Illinois and it didn't appear the prospects were going to be efficient. Spoke with Atty Hendee and is asking the Court to reconsider the probation sentence and order a straight jail sentence.  Atty Hendee has no objection and believes the sentence would be 30 days in jail with credit for the time defendant has already been serving.  Court questions defendant..  Defendant states he will reject probation at this time.  BY THE COURT:  Court accepts that request and the JOC will be amended to remove the withheld sentence with probation.
Atty Hendee has no further recommendation and notes victim notification requirements have been met.  
Atty Gumz makes further statement.
BY THE COURT:  Court will sentence defendant to serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail, to begin forthwith.  Granted 5 days credit as of 2/2/17.

Defendant William Albert Lucansky in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz statest that the defense is prepared to proceed today.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
*10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
*Report forthwith
Credit = 5 days (if revoked)
*Court costs = $243.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Fines and costs to be paid during the time of Probation
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Exhibits 1-16

Signed Guilty Count 2
Signed Not Guilty Count 1

Unsigned-Not Guily-Count 2
Unsigned-Guily-Count 1

for Return/Destruction of Exhibits  
Signed by BNB/1-12-17
**Full Jury Trial minutes from January 12th

**SEE FULL JURY TRIAL NOTES IN MINUTES 

4:17pm   Clerk administers Oath to Bailiff's.

4:17pm  Jury excused for deliberation. 
Court remains in session
Court questions counsel on exhibits and they will go into the jury room if requested.  
Atty Hendee agrees.
Atty Gumz agrees.
4:18 pm  Recess
5:19pm  Jury has reached a verdict.
Jury in, Court in Session

The Jury finds the defendant NOT GUILTY of Count 1 Disorderly Conduct.

The Jury finds the defendant GUILTY of Count 2 Battery.

5:22pm Court polls the 6 Jurors on their verdict. 

5:23pm   Court thanks the Jurors for their service.
Jury excused.

5:23pm  Court accepts the verdicts and will dismiss Ct. 1.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct. 2, Batter and the conviction will be entered as of today's date.

Atty Gumz asks for a sentencing date.  
Atty Hendee takes no position.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Sentencing
Sentencing set for February 2, 2017 at 10:45am
bond continued.
Sentencing hearing on February 2, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz appeared by phone means for Defendant William Albert Lucansky. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant William Albert Lucansky appeared by video means.
Atty Hendee states that he will email Atty Gumz the criminal complaint.  Atty Gumz is prepared to proceed as long as his client has a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court questions the defendant.    Defendant confirms that he received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court finds probable cause.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  
Atty Gumz responds and states that his client does not have any issues with the conditions.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No violent or abusive contact with Henry Wrzinski
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Atty Gumz states that he now has a copy of the criminal complaint and enters a Not Guilty plea.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Trial  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
